page.title: 20RECREATION-PLAYGROUND RHYMES
page.content: At Woodhouse West School we still play skipping and other singing games.There are some of the rhymes we sing: {Somebody's under the bed, whoever can it be? It makes me feel jolly frightened so --- comes in to see.First she lights the candle then she lights the light. Get out you fool, get out you fool, there's a monkey on your arm. {I had a daughter who lived in Majorca.She had a penny to keep her alive. Singing hulla, hulla, hulla,That's the way the money goes. Da, da, da, da, da. {Orange bells, orange bells, here we go again woo. Orange bells, orange bells, here we go again. Last one down a, b, c.
